decks.notes: Fast, aggressive spells combined with efficient creatures to maintain board control and pressure the opponent early in the game. Utilizing a combination of counterspells, burn spells, and disruptive creatures to disrupt the opponent's game plan and quickly close out the game. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while also presenting a fast clock to end the game before the opponent can stabilize. The strategy revolves around synergy between low-cost spells and creatures to create a fast, high-powered tempo to overwhelm the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize, Hymn to Tourach, and Force of Will while deploying efficient threats like True-Name Nemesis and Leovold, Emissary of Trest. It also aims to control the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay, as well as generate card advantage with Baleful Strix and Planeswalkers like Liliana, the Last Hope and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The mana base is designed to support the deck's powerful spells while utilizing cards like Deathrite Shaman for additional value.

The deck focuses on using lands as a resource to control the game. It utilizes cards like Life from the Loam, Crop Rotation, and Exploration to manipulate the battlefield, while also utilizing lands like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create powerful threats. Control elements like Punishing Fire and Maze of Ith help deal with opposing threats, while cards like Wasteland and Ghost Quarter disrupt the opponent's mana base. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by generating incremental advantage through its land-based interactions.

The main focus of this UWx Control deck is to disrupt opponents' strategies by utilizing counter spells and removal spells like Swords to Plowshares. It aims to control the game by manipulating the top of the deck with cards like Predict and Counterbalance, while also gaining card advantage with Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Search for Azcanta. The deck also seeks to establish a strong board presence with Monastery Mentor and Snapcaster Mage. Overall, this deck aims to control the pace of the game and outvalue opponents with efficient spells and powerful planeswalkers.

The deck focuses on using aggressive creatures like Young Pyromancer, True-Name Nemesis, and Delver of Secrets to quickly pressure the opponent. It also includes disruption cards like Force of Will, Daze, and Spell Pierce to protect its threats and control the game. The mana base includes powerful lands like Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base, while also including efficient removal like Lightning Bolt and Deathrite Shaman for further control options. The deck aims to win the game quickly by applying constant pressure and disrupting the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of hand disruption, counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers. It aims to control the game by manipulating the opponent's resources and outvaluing them with card advantage. With a mix of disruption, card draw, and efficient threats, this deck can adapt to various matchups and maintain control of the game. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's plans, control the board, and win through incremental advantage.

The deck is focused on using powerful control elements like Counterspell, Force of Will, and Swords to Plowshares to disrupt the opponent's game plan. It also utilizes card selection tools like Brainstorm and Ponder to find the right answers at the right time. The win condition comes from generating advantage with cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Entreat the Angels, while also having a backup plan with creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Vendilion Clique. The deck aims to control the game until it can stabilize and finish off the opponent with its powerful threats.

This deck focuses on using aggressive creatures like Knight of the Reliquary and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Swords to Plowshares and Gaddock Teeg. The deck also includes mana acceleration with Deathrite Shaman and Noble Hierarch, and powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Fire and Ice to increase the effectiveness of its creatures in combat. The land base is designed to provide mana consistency while also utilizing utility lands like Wasteland and Karakas to further disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on utilizing lands for control, utilizing cards like Gamble, Exploration, and Life from the Loam to manipulate the battlefield. Crucible of Worlds and Engineered Explosives provide additional control options, while Punishing Fire and Molten Vortex help deal with opposing threats. The deck also includes a lands package with cards like Ghost Quarter, Wasteland, and Dark Depths to disrupt opponents' mana base and create advantageous board states. By leveraging the synergy between lands and control elements, this deck aims to outmaneuver opponents and secure victory through resource denial and land-based strategies.

The primary focus of this Grixis Aggro deck is to utilize efficient creatures like Young Pyromancer, Delver of Secrets, and Gurmag Angler, combined with powerful spells like Lightning Bolt and True-Name Nemesis to pressure the opponent quickly and aggressively while disrupting their strategy with cards like Daze and Force of Will. The mana denial strategy with cards like Wasteland and the utility of Deathrite Shaman provide additional tools to control the pace of the game and maintain pressure on the opponent. Overall, the deck aims to establish early dominance and close out the game before the opponent can recover.

This deck focuses on quickly pumping up small infect creatures like Blighted Agent and Glistener Elf to deal 10 infect damage to win the game. It includes cards like Invigorate, Berserk, and Become Immense to give these creatures a huge power boost. The deck also includes cheap control elements like Daze and Force of Will to protect the combo. The deck's mana base includes fetch lands and Tropical Island to ensure it has the right colors of mana to cast its spells efficiently.

The deck focuses on utilizing the combo of Dark Depths and Vampire Hexmage to generate a 20/20 Marit Lage token. It includes cards like Exhume, Entomb, and Shallow Grave to quickly put Griselbrand or other key creatures into play. The deck also has disruption in the form of Cabal Therapy, Thoughtseize, and Unmask to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the inclusion of Living Wish allows for additional toolbox flexibility in finding necessary pieces for the combo or for protection. The deck's synergy and speed make it a potent threat in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through a combination of disruption, card advantage, and efficient removal spells. The deck uses a mix of counterspells, hand disruption, and removal like Fatal Push and Diabolic Edict to keep the opponent from executing their game plan. Card advantage is generated through cards like Brainstorm and Snapcaster Mage, while powerful threats like Leovold, Emissary of Trest and Jace, the Mind Sculptor help close out the game. The deck also has access to powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor to help control the game.

This control deck focuses on disruption and removal spells to control the game while using powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana of the Veil to grind out value. It also utilizes powerful creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Baleful Strix to generate card advantage and pressure the opponent. The deck utilizes a diverse manabase to support its 4/5 color control strategy, allowing for flexibility in casting spells and ensuring consistency in hitting land drops. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outtempo the opponent while disrupting their game plan.

The deck focuses on assembling the Dark Depths combo as quickly as possible, using cards like Crop Rotation, Sylvan Scrying, and Thespian's Stage to put together the 20/20 Marit Lage token. The deck also includes disruption elements like Thoughtseize and Duress to protect the combo, as well as utility cards like Pithing Needle and Sylvan Safekeeper. The deck can generate mana quickly with Lotus Petal and Elvish Spirit Guide, and can also protect the combo with cards like Sejiri Steppe. The goal is to win the game with the powerful Marit Lage token before the opponent can stop it.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan by using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption. It also includes value creatures like Baleful Strix, Snapcaster Mage, and Leovold, Emissary of Trest to generate card advantage while pressuring the opponent. The mana base is diverse to support the deck's color requirements, allowing for flexibility and consistency in casting spells. Overall, the deck aims to control the game through efficient removal and disruption, while slowly pulling ahead with card advantage and powerful planeswalker abilities.
